Exaggerate: The claim may be considered an exaggeration as it states that each vegan spares more than 100 animals every year, which may not be entirely accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the statement that each vegan spares more than 100 animals every year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all non-vegans consume at least 100 animals a year, which may not be a valid assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the number of animals spared by vegans, which are not mentioned in the claim.
